title: Mean Bar Plot for any metric — create_bar
code: create_bar(   data,   metric,   hrvar = "Organization",   mingroup = 5,   return = "plot",   bar_colour = "default",   na.rm = FALSE,   percent = FALSE,   plot_title = us_to_space(metric),   plot_subtitle = paste("Average by", tolower(camel_clean(hrvar))),   legend_lab = NULL,   rank = "descending",   xlim = NULL,   text_just = 0.5,   text_colour = "#FFFFFF" )

title: Mean Bar Plot for any metric — create_bar
text: data Standard Person Query dataset form data frame. metric Character string containing name metric, e.g. "Collaboration_hours" hrvar String containing name HR Variable split metrics. Defaults "Organization". run analysis total instead splitting HR attribute, supply NULL (without quotes). mingroup Numeric value setting privacy threshold / minimum group size. Defaults 5. return String specifying return. must one following strings: "plot" "table" See Value information. bar_colour String specify colour use bars. -built accepted values include "default" (default), "alert" (red), "darkblue". Otherwise, hex codes also accepted. can also supply RGB values via rgb2hex(). na.rm logical value indicating whether NA stripped computation proceeds. Defaults FALSE. percent Logical value determine whether show labels percentage signs. Defaults FALSE. plot_title option override plot title. plot_subtitle option override plot subtitle. legend_lab String. Option override legend title/label. Defaults NULL, metric name populated instead. rank String specifying rank bars. Valid inputs : "descending" - ranked highest lowest top bottom (default). "ascending" - ranked lowest highest top bottom. NULL - uses original levels HR attribute. xlim option set max value x axis. text_just numeric value controlling horizontal position text labels. Defaults 0.5. text_colour String specify colour use text labels. Defaults "#FFFFFF".

text: different output returned depending value passed return argument: "plot": 'ggplot' object. bar plot metric. "table": data frame. summary table metric.

title: Create a bar chart without aggregation for any metric — create_bar_asis
text: 'ggplot' object. horizontal bar plot.

title: Create a bar chart without aggregation for any metric — create_bar_asis
code: # Creating a custom bar plot without mean aggregation library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  pq_data %>%   group_by(Organization) %>%   summarise(across(.cols = Meeting_hours,                    .fns = ~sum(., na.rm = TRUE))) %>%   create_bar_asis(group_var = "Organization",                   bar_var = "Meeting_hours",                   title = "Total Meeting Hours over period",                   subtitle = "By Organization",                   caption = extract_date_range(pq_data, return = "text"),                   bar_colour = "darkblue",                   rounding = 0)   library(dplyr)  # Summarise Non-person-average median `Emails_sent` med_df <-   pq_data %>%   group_by(Organization) %>%   summarise(Emails_sent_median = median(Emails_sent))  med_df %>%   create_bar_asis(     group_var = "Organization",     bar_var = "Emails_sent_median",     title = "Emails sent by organization",     subtitle = "Median values",     bar_colour = "darkblue",     caption = extract_date_range(pq_data, return = "text")   )

text: data Standard Person Query dataset form data frame. hrvar String containing name HR Variable split metrics. Valid inputs "plot" "table". stack_colours character vector specify colour codes stacked bar charts. percent Logical value determine whether show labels percentage signs. Defaults FALSE. plot_title String. Option override plot title. plot_subtitle String. Option override plot subtitle. legend_lab String. Option override legend title/label. Defaults NULL, metric name populated instead. rank String specifying rank bars. Valid inputs : "descending" - ranked highest lowest top bottom (default). "ascending" - ranked lowest highest top bottom. NULL - uses original levels HR attribute. xlim option set max value x axis. text_just numeric value controlling horizontal position text labels. Defaults 0.5. text_colour String specify colour use text labels. Defaults "#FFFFFF".

what: Distribution of Email Hours as a 100% stacked bar — email_dist
title: Distribution of Email Hours as a 100% stacked bar — email_dist
text: Analyze Email Hours distribution. Returns stacked bar plot default. Additional options available return table distribution elements.

title: Distribution of Email Hours as a 100% stacked bar — email_dist
code: email_dist(   data,   hrvar = "Organization",   mingroup = 5,   return = "plot",   cut = c(0.5, 1, 1.5) )

title: Distribution of Email Hours as a 100% stacked bar — email_dist
text: data Standard Person Query dataset form data frame. hrvar String containing name HR Variable split metrics. Defaults "Organization". run analysis total instead splitting HR attribute, supply NULL (without quotes). mingroup Numeric value setting privacy threshold / minimum group size. Defaults 5. return String specifying return. must one following strings: "plot" "table" See Value information. cut numeric vector length three specify breaks distribution, e.g. c(10, 15, 20)

title: Distribution of Email Hours as a 100% stacked bar — email_dist
text: different output returned depending value passed return argument: "plot": 'ggplot' object. stacked bar plot metric. "table": data frame. summary table metric.

title: Distribution of Email Hours as a 100% stacked bar — email_dist

Email Hours Ranking — email_rank
text: function scans standard query output groups high levels 'Weekly Email Collaboration'. Returns plot default, option return table groups (across multiple HR attributes) ranked hours digital collaboration.

title: Email Hours Ranking — email_rank
code: email_rank(   data,   hrvar = extract_hr(data),   mingroup = 5,   mode = "simple",   plot_mode = 1,   return = "plot" )

title: Email Hours Ranking — email_rank
text: data Standard Person Query dataset form data frame. hrvar String containing name HR Variable split metrics. Defaults "Organization". run analysis total instead splitting HR attribute, supply NULL (without quotes). mingroup Numeric value setting privacy threshold / minimum group size. Defaults 5. mode String specify calculation mode. Must either: "simple" "combine" plot_mode Numeric vector determine plot mode return. Must either 1 2, used return = "plot". 1: Top bottom five groups across data population highlighted 2: Top bottom groups per organizational attribute highlighted return String specifying return. must one following strings: "plot" (default) "table" See Value information.

title: Email Hours Ranking — email_rank
text: different output returned depending value passed return argument: "plot": 'ggplot' object. bubble plot x-axis represents metric, y-axis represents HR attributes, size bubbles represent size organizations. Note plot output mode set "combine". "table": data frame. summary table metric.

title: Run a summary of Key Metrics without aggregation — keymetrics_scan_asis
text: Return heatmapped table directly aggregated / summarised data. Unlike keymetrics_scan() performs person-level aggregation, calculation keymetrics_scan_asis() values rendered passed function.

title: Run a summary of Key Metrics without aggregation — keymetrics_scan_asis
code: keymetrics_scan_asis(   data,   row_var,   col_var,   group_var = col_var,   value_var = "value",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   caption = NULL,   ylab = row_var,   xlab = "Metrics",   rounding = 1,   low = rgb2hex(7, 111, 161),   mid = rgb2hex(241, 204, 158),   high = rgb2hex(216, 24, 42),   textsize = 2 )

title: Run a summary of Key Metrics without aggregation — keymetrics_scan_asis
text: data data frame containing data plot. recommended provide data 'long' table format one grouping column forms rows, second column forms columns, third numeric columns forms row_var String containing name grouping variable form rows heatmapped table. col_var String containing name grouping variable form columns heatmapped table. group_var String containing name grouping variable heatmapping apply. Defaults col_var. value_var String containing name value variable form values heatmapped table. Defaults "value". title Title plot. subtitle Subtitle plot. caption Caption plot. ylab Y-axis label plot (group axis) xlab X-axis label plot (bar axis). rounding Numeric value specify number digits show data labels low String specifying colour code use low-value metrics. Arguments passed directly ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient2(). mid String specifying colour code use mid-value metrics. Arguments passed directly ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient2(). high String specifying colour code use high-value metrics. Arguments passed directly ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient2(). textsize numeric value specifying text size show plot.

title: Run a summary of Key Metrics without aggregation — keymetrics_scan_asis
text: ggplot object heatmap table.

title: Run a summary of Key Metrics without aggregation — keymetrics_scan_asis
code: library(dplyr)  # Compute summary table out_df <-   pq_data %>%   group_by(Organization) %>%   summarise(     across(       .cols = c(         Email_hours,         Collaboration_hours         ),       .fns = ~median(., na.rm = TRUE)       ),       .groups = "drop"     ) %>% tidyr::pivot_longer(   cols = c("Email_hours", "Collaboration_hours"),   names_to = "metrics" )  keymetrics_scan_asis(   data = out_df,   col_var = "metrics",   row_var = "Organization" )   # Show data the other way round keymetrics_scan_asis(   data = out_df,   col_var = "Organization",   row_var = "metrics",   group_var = "metrics" )
